newsitem.title: UK: Ukraine to name Eurobond manager in few weeks.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine to name Eurobond manager in few weeks.

text.p: Ukraine expects to appoint a lead manager for its planned first Eurobond issue within the next few weeks and will soon request a credit rating, Finance Minister Ihor Mityukov said.

Mityukov, in London for the annual meeting of the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development (EBRD), said he expected his country to issue between 250 and 500 million dollars but he did not specify the likely maturity.
Asked by reporters when a lead manager would be appointed, he replied: "Very soon, in the next few weeks."
"We seriously intend to start Eurobond issues this year," he added.
An official request for a credit rating would be made when the lead manager had been appointed.
Mityukov said it was important to resolve the current wrangling between the government and parliament over the budget before seeking a rating.

"I fully understand that it will be impossible to get the rating without budget approval," he said. The minister earlier told Reuters Financial Television he expected the budget to be approved by early May at the latest.
Asked what rating he hoped for, he replied: "At least not less than Russia."
Russia is rated BB+ by IBCA, BB- by Standard and Poors and Ba2 by Moody's.
